Class PresetSELocationModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • PresetSELocationModule

  • public class PresetSELocationModule
extends java.lang.Object
    This module is used to set frames and detect sources/targets in the case that the locations of subjective expressions are known and can be found in a Salsa XML file. Sources and targets are found by either using default rules or lexicon rules, depending on the config value of ignoreLexicon. This module includes the functionality of the other two modules and should thus never be used in conjunction with them. Consequently, the options for the other two modules are relevant for the preset SE location module as well.
    Author:
    isha, mwolf

    • Constructor Detail

      • PresetSELocationModule

        public PresetSELocationModule(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> SEsFromInput,
                      SentenceList sentences,
                      SentimentLex lex,
                      boolean findSources,
                      boolean findTargets,
                      boolean ignoreLexicon,
                      Module giModule)
        Constructor for PresetSELocationModule.
        Parameters:
        SEsFromInput - List of SEs collected from the SubtaskParser.
        sentences - The sentences from the rawSentences file.
        lex - The sentiment lexicon.
        findSources - Determines whether to look for sources.
        findTargets - Determines whether to look for targets.
        ignoreLexicon - Determines whether to consider the sentiment lexicon.
        giModule - GrammarInducedModule is used to check for auxilary and modal verbs and find correct sources and targets for these words. The reason PresetSELocationModule uses methods from GrammarInducedModule, instead of using both modules at the same time, is to prevent the setting of multiple Frames for one SE.

    • Method Detail

      • findFrames

        public java.util.Collection<Frame> findFrames(SentenceObj sentence)
        Finds and sets frames for SEs and optionally looks for sources and targets. Works with the SEs from the input from the SubjectiveExpressionLocationPath.
        Parameters:
        sentence - The SentenceObj which is to be checked for sentiment expressions.
        Returns:
        set frames.

                                 java.lang.String sentenceId)
        Returns the matching sentence in the SentenceList given a sentenceId.
        Parameters:
        sentences - The complete sentence list.
        sentenceId - The Id of the sentence to be matched.
        Returns:
        The matching sentence as SentenceObj.

        public WordObj findWordObj(SentenceObj toAnalyse,
                  java.lang.String subjId)
        Returns the fitting wordObj given a SentenceObj and a word Id as String.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyse - The sentenceObj representing the current sentence.

        Returns:

                                                            java.lang.String posSubjExpr,
                                                            java.lang.String nameSubjExpr,
                                                            java.lang.String subjId)
        Get default rules for source candidates as a list of dependency relations.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyse - The sentenceObj representing the current sentence.
        posSubjExpr - The POS-Tag of the current SE-word.
        nameSubjExpr - The name of the current SE-word.
        subjId - The current word's Id.
        Returns:
        A list of strings with dependency relations or null.
